name: Sang Bin Lee
content:
Sang Bin Lee is a finance academic, best known as developer of the Ho–Lee short-rate model, the first arbitrage-free model of that type. He is widely published in major journals,[1] and has co-authored four finance texts.[2] He is Professor of Finance at Hanyang University and President Elect of the Korean Securities Association.  Previously, he was an assistant director Ministry of Finance, Korea and an Independent Director and a member of Risk Management Committee, Hana Bank.[3] He received his Bachelor of Business Administration from Seoul National University (1975), a Master of Economics from  Cornell University (1981) and a Ph.D in Business Administration from  New York University (1985; Dissertation: “Term Structure Movements and the Pricing of Corporate Bond Provisions").
 
 This article about an Asian economist is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it.

raw:
Sang Bin Lee is a finance academic, best known as developer of the Ho–Lee short-rate model, the first arbitrage-free model of that type. He is widely published in major journals,[1] and has co-authored four finance texts.[2] He is Professor of Finance at Hanyang University and President Elect of the Korean Securities Association.  Previously, he was an assistant director Ministry of Finance, Korea and an Independent Director and a member of Risk Management Committee, Hana Bank.[3] He received his Bachelor of Business Administration from Seoul National University (1975), a Master of Economics from  Cornell University (1981) and a Ph.D in Business Administration from  New York University (1985; Dissertation: “Term Structure Movements and the Pricing of Corporate Bond Provisions").
